page.title: 09BOLTON PERCY POPULATION
page.content: Census records show the{population} has remained fairly constant since 1851 at about 300;families are smaller but the number of houses has tripled. Since 1945 local employment has fallen off, causing a drift away from the village.10 persons over 40 years and educated locally are still resident. In 1966-70 40{houses}were built bringing children to the school and new residents who adapted well to "village life". The{cost of houses}has since risen dramatically (a Â£4000 bungalow in 1966 was sold in 1981 @ Â£34000)> In 1980 13 houses were built at Â£60000+.The newer residents are either retired or "excutives" who commute 30 miles to work. There are fewer children for the school." The{"quality of village life" has dropped as few newcomers support village activities."D.Critall.
